title: Biden Urges Netanyahu to Find ‘Genuine Compromise’ on Court Plan
description: US President Joe Biden said he had strong concerns about Israel’s democracy and expressed hope that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu would reach a compromise with his opponents over a planned judicial overhaul that has sparked widespread protests in the country.

title: Fed Watchdog Launches Investigation Into SVB Supervision
description: The Federal Reserve’s internal watchdog has launched its own review of the failure of Silicon Valley Bank, a spokesman confirmed, separate from the probe that the Fed’s vice chair for supervision is leading.

title: Biden Says Markets ‘Settling’ Down From Banking Turmoil
description: President Joe Biden expressed confidence that the crisis involving US regional banks was easing but said he was not sure legislation addressing the situation would get through Congress.

title: Biden Says He Intends to Expose Those Blocking New Gun Laws
description: President Joe Biden said he would put the spotlight on those blocking the passage of new gun laws, as he expressed frustration with the lack of legislative progress on the issue, a day after a mass shooting at a grade school in Nashville, Tennessee.

title: Top Biden Aide Speaks With Chinese Counterpart as Tensions Flare
description: White House National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan spoke with China’s top diplomat Wang Yi on Friday, people familiar with the matter said, with relations between the world’s two largest economies severely strained.

title: Canada Plots Tax on Banks, Raising Billions With Dividend Levy
description: In a measure that officials billed as closing a loophole, Canada will begin treating dividends received by financial institutions from holding domestic shares as business income. It’s expected to bring in C$3.2 billion ($2.3 billion) over five years, starting in 2024.

title: Here Are the Key Takeaways in Canada’s Budget
description: Key Takeaways

title: Trudeau Ramps Up Spending in Race to Keep Up With US Subsidies
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government is pumping billions of dollars into clean energy subsidies and health care, despite a gloomy forecast of slow economic growth and weaker tax revenue.

title: GOP Demands Speedy Energy Permits as Price to Boost Debt Limit
description: Republicans are floating legislation that would ease energy permitting in exchange for raising the US debt ceiling, creating a potential path to avoid a default.

title: Biden Praises New Chip Factory in Trip to 2024 Battleground
description: President Joe Biden touted legislation providing subsidies for semiconductors Tuesday in North Carolina, highlighting his economic agenda in a crucial battleground state for the upcoming presidential election.

title: Italy Wants to Ban Cultivated Food to Protect Culinary Heritage
description: A chef shreds a piece of cultivated thin-cut steak in the Aleph Farms Ltd. development kitchen in Rehovot, Israel, on Sunday, Nov. 27, 2022. The UN predicted last year that with the world's population expected to climb by 11% in the coming decade, meat consumption would rise by an even greater 14%. Photographer: Corinna Kern/Bloomberg

title: SVB Management and Banking Rules Put on Trial at Senate Hearing
description: The fallout of Silicon Valley Bank’s failure rumbled through Washington on Tuesday, with lawmakers from both parties demanding that the Federal Reserve explain why it didn’t use powers it had and some Democrats calling for tighter financial rules.

title: Germany’s Fractious Coalition Strikes Deal After Three Days
description: Olaf Scholz, Germany's incoming chancellor, center, Robert Habeck, co-leader of the Green Party, left, and Christian Lindner, Germany's finance minister, attend a signing ceremony of the coalition agreement to form a government in Berlin, Germany, on Tuesday, Dec. 7, 2021. Scholz cleared the final hurdle on his path to becoming German chancellor when Green Party members overwhelmingly approved their coalition deal with his center-left Social Democrats and the pro-business Free Democrats. Photographer: Liesa Johannssen-Koppitz/Bloomberg

title: Mystery Over Abandoned Yacht Grows as Russian Tycoon Denies Link
description: The mystery surrounding who owns an abandoned 267-foot superyacht docked in Antigua and Barbuda deepened after lawyers for Russian billionaire Andrey Guryev said their client doesn’t own the vessel, and the government pushed ahead with plans to auction it off.

title: Italy Scales Down Energy Relief With New €4.9 Billion Package
description: Street lights lit up outside a residential tower block at night in Brescia, Italy, on Sunday, July 3, 2022. Italy's government plans further measures to cushion the impact of high energy prices, including extending a fuel tax holiday to the beginning of October, Il Messaggero newspaper reported. Photographer: Francesca Volpi/Bloomberg

title: Pence Ordered to Testify to Trump Special Counsel Grand Jury
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence was ordered by a judge to testify before a grand jury hearing evidence from the special counsel investigating Donald Trump and his allies’ efforts to overturn the 2020 election, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Here Are the Key Takeaways From the Senate Hearing on Bank Failures
description: Here are five key takeaways from the US Senate Banking Committee’s questioning of federal regulators on the recent banks failures:

title: Private Medicare Insurers Blasted by Warren for Driving Up Costs
description: Big insurers who manage private Medicare plans are driving up seniors’ health costs, US Senator Elizabeth Warren said, urging the Biden administration to finalize new rules that would rein in how much the program pays companies.

title: A Long-Term Deal to Raise the US Debt Ceiling Is Looking Unlikely
description: A long term deal to raise the debt ceiling is increasingly out of reach as Speaker Kevin McCarthy amps up Republican demands for deep spending cuts in exchange for their agreement to increase the US borrowing limit and President Joe Biden refuses to negotiate.

title: Senator Presses Tesla, GM on Possible Links to Forced Labor in China
description: Senator Ron Wyden is pressing automakers including Tesla Inc. and General Motors Co. for more information about their supply chains amid concerns about forced labor in China.

title: Top Macron Ally Calls for Pause of Pension Reform Plan
description: Philippe Aghion, a French economist who’s advised Emmanuel Macron on his economic program, is joining a growing chorus calling for the president to hit the pause button on his pension reform in the face of rising anger on the streets.

title: Daunted by Trump, Many Wait to Launch 2024 Bids
description: Here are the people who have announced and who might later.

title: North Korean Hackers Posed as NY Times, Voice of America Staff
description: Nuclear policy was a main focus of the espionage efforts, researchers said.

title: Paris Garbage Workers to Suspend Strike Against Pension Reform
description: After days of walking around bins overflowing with uncollected rubbish, Parisians may soon hear the familiar rumble of garbage trucks making the rounds to pick up the trash in their neighborhoods.

title: Myanmar Junta Dissolves Suu Kyi’s Party After It Boycotts Poll
description: Myanmar’s military government dissolved the National League for Democracy, the pro-democracy party of Aung San Suu Kyi, after it failed to register as a political entity for upcoming elections.

title: Blinken Backs Ukraine’s Peace Proposal, Warns Against China’s
description: The US supports Ukraine’s peace framework, which demands the withdrawal of all Russian forces from Ukrainian territory, and opposes alternate proposals that would advantage Moscow, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Tuesday.

title: Thirty-Nine Migrants Dead as Fire Highlights Mexico-US Tension
description: A fire that killed 39 migrants who were about to be deported from Ciudad Juarez highlights the increasing tension over Mexico’s continued crackdown on migrants aiming to reach the US.

title: FDA Proposes New Baby-Formula Safety Measures After Recall Led to US Shortages
description: US regulators are proposing an “immediate” strategy to ensure safe, adequate supplies of baby formula that were in nationwide shortage after reports of contamination led to recalls last year.

title: US Officials Signal New Rules for Banks After SVB, Signature Failures
description: Top US financial officials on Tuesday outlined what’s likely to be the biggest regulatory overhaul of the banking sector in years, in an initiative aimed at addressing underlying issues that contributed to the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and other US regional lenders.

title: Sunak Says Xi’s Actions Undermine China’s Credibility on Ukraine
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak warned that China’s actions “undermine their credibility” as a neutral party on Ukraine, and urged President Xi Jinping to “use his influence with Putin to end this war.”

title: Yousaf Elected as Scotland's New First Minister in Holyrood Vote
description: SNP leader Humza Yousaf has been voted in by MSPs as Scotland's youngest First Minister and the first from a minority ethnic background.

title: Israel’s Master Contortionist Netanyahu Tests Political Limits
description: Benjamin Netanyahu’s ability to pull off political escape acts and outmaneuver rivals is a legend in Israel. Even a collection of scandals didn’t block him from winning office.

title: Money Managers Raise Alarms Over Anti-ESG Crusade in GOP States
description: Pension managers and fiscal watchdogs are raising alarms, and lawmakers are listening.

title: McCarthy Scolds Biden on the US Debt Limit, Demands Start to Talks
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy sent a letter to President Joe Biden on Tuesday demanding negotiations start on raising the US debt limit and outlined proposed spending cuts and regulatory changes that House Republicans would like to see attached.

title: Israel Crisis Explained: Attempt to Change Legal System Sparks Protests
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has delayed by a few months his government’s plan to limit the powers of the country’s judiciary. The pause came in response to massive protests that raged across the country and a one-day general strike that shut down much of the economy. Netanyahu said he aimed to pull Israelis back from the brink of a civil war.

title: US, China Rivalry May Stoke Conflict With India Along Border
description: As ties between Washington and Beijing worsen, border tensions between India and China could spiral into a bigger conflict, the South Asian nation’s army chief warned.

title: Poland Wants Tougher EU Sanctions on Belarus After Nuclear Move
description: Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki called on European Union members to impose new restrictions on Belarus after Vladimir Putin announced Russia will station nuclear weapons in the country.

title: Brazil Central Bank Sees Finance Ministry Committed to Fiscal Package
description: Brazil’s central bank gave a nod to Finance Minister Fernando Haddad’s efforts to approve a fiscal package to shore up public finances, saying such measures could help reduce upside risks to inflation.

title: Two Dead, Several Injured in Muslim Center Stabbing in Portugal
description: LISBON, Portugal (AP) — Portuguese police shot a man suspected of stabbing two people to death at an Ismaili Muslim center in Lisbon, authorities said Tuesday.

title: Norway in ‘Process’ with Russia to Transfer Arctic Council Chair
description: Norway is “in a constructive process” with Russia to ensure a handover of the chairmanship of the Arctic Council after the intergovernmental body was suspended in the aftermath of the war in Ukraine, according to a senior official.

title: Influencers, Online Mobs Targeted in China Social Media Cleanup
description: China plans to crack down on harmful social media content, in a sign that the country’s internet firms — already roiled by previous curbs — will face continued scrutiny from the authorities.

title: Peru’s Indigenous Sacrifice Livelihoods in a Quest to Oust the President
description: Poverty in Puno has shot up to 80% as road blockades and boycotts hobble mining, tourism.

title: Lockheed Hypersonic Missile Test Marred by In-Flight Data Loss
description: The second test flight of Lockheed Martin Corp.’s hypersonic missile prototype was marred by the weapon’s failure to transmit in-flight performance data, two people familiar with the results said, a setback for US efforts to catch up with China and Russia in a key weapons capability.

title: Putin’s Nuclear Gambit Tests Xi’s Influence
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping is working overtime to fashion himself as a statesman on the global stage. His “old friend” in Russia isn’t helping.

title: Regulators Are Coming for Crypto, and Even Binance Isn’t Immune
description: The CFTC sues the largest trading platform and its founder, Changpeng Zhao, while Coinbase and a popular DeFi app are under scrutiny from the SEC.

title: Senators Ask Powell If Fed Used Full Powers to Supervise SVB
description: A bipartisan group of senators have sent a letter to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell questioning whether the central bank exercised its full legal authority to oversee Silicon Valley Bank and other midsized financial institutions.

title: Philippines to Cut Contact With International Criminal Court
description: The Philippines will cut contact with the International Criminal Court after it denied the government’s request to suspend the probe on former leader Rodrigo Duterte’s deadly drug war, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said.

title: Greece Calls Elections as Premier Mitsotakis Faces Train Crash Fallout
description: Greece will head to the polls on May 21, Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said Tuesday, with a second ballot likely to be needed about a month later.

title: Scotland’s New Leader Reflects the Diversifying Ranks of UK Politics
description: The election of Humza Yousaf means that three of Britain’s most powerful politicians are ethnic minorities.

title: Ukraine Latest: Kyiv Hits Shahed Drones; EU Focus on Russian LNG
description: Ukrainian forces downed 14 out of 15 Shahed-type drones launched by Russian troops overnight, Ukraine’s General Staff said on Facebook. Twelve UAVs were shot down over Kyiv, the city’s military administration said.

title: War and Secretive Spending Is Eating Away at Russia’s Budget
description: Russia is keeping an unprecedented one-third of its budget spending out of the public eye, a stark measure of how a year of war against Ukraine has redrawn government finances and economic priorities.

title: Israel Latest: Protesters Clash With Police as Netanyahu U-Turns
description: Israel’s President called on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and opposition leaders to immediately start talks after another night of protests.

title: Ending Affirmative Action Harms College Diversity If Legacy Preferences Stand
description: Without race consideration, universities will have few options to retain diversity, according to a new study

title: France Faces New Pension Strikes as Concerns Over Violence Mount
description: French unions are holding a new day of nationwide strikes Tuesday to try to force President Emmanuel Macron to reverse his decision to push through unpopular pension reforms.

title: Russia Says it Test-Fired Supersonic Missiles in The Sea of Japan
description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia's Defense Ministry says Moscow has test-fired anti-ship missiles in the Sea of Japan.

title: New Zealand Open to Non-Nuclear Talks With Aukus, Minister Says
description: New Zealand is open to discussing non-nuclear cooperation with the Aukus security partnership between the US, the UK and Australia, Defence Minister Andrew Little said.

title: Kim Jong Un Threatens Nuclear Use Anytime as US Carrier Arrives
description: Leader Kim Jong Un said North Korea is ready to use nuclear weapons “anytime and anywhere,” delivering a new threat as a US aircraft carrier group arrives in South Korea.
